html:
5.11.21  3:00 am   For me, making music with other musicians together in a room is a very pleasant experience, and generally more viscerally pleasant than recording music separately or by myself.

      I know working alone has some clear advantages, but I was wondering, do you get a unique sort of satisfaction when you play with other people?

      What's that experience like for you?

     
Thanks, your work ethic and pragmatism changed my life
5.11.21  2:47 am   Why is Ï€ spelled pi?

5.11.21  12:58 am   what do you use to sing one of your songs?

     
(if there are more, what are they?)
5.10.21  11:00 pm   What's a tip you have for developing interesting chord progressions?

5.10.21  9:30 pm   I've made a few songs but feel like they have no sensible composition since there's no melody, theme, or motif that repeats. Is something that just sort of keeps going but shifts in tone or mood throughout still a good "song"?
5.10.21  6:12 pm   How many words are in the title of the next song?
5.10.21  5:26 pm   do you ever wish you could go back to your old editing style sometimes
5.10.21  4:50 pm   are you planning on making a fourth song in 2021?
5.10.21  3:58 pm   will playing your music to my newborn make them speak in lowercase?
5.10.21  3:55 pm   How much every does it get?
5.10.21  3:17 pm   How do I get better at identifying chords by ear (I, IV, V, etc.)

5.10.21  3:00 pm   "We don't know where we get our ideas from. What we do know is that we do not get them from our laptops."
How much do you agree with this quote by John Cleese?
5.10.21  2:54 pm   What makes someone genius?
5.10.21  2:31 pm   Also, what are the names of the recurring patches you use most in your music?
5.10.21  1:45 pm   what is the first letter in the name of you next song?
5.10.21  1:41 pm   is your next song about common things in life?
5.10.21  12:55 pm   why are you strangely talented?
5.10.21  12:04 pm   Will you be bringing back the notebook
5.10.21  11:55 am   do you put cereal before the milk or vice versa
5.10.21  10:10 am   Do you have COVID-19?
5.10.21  9:37 am   what is one problem you think the absolutely weak power of friendship can solve?
5.10.21  8:46 am   Do you use auto-tune
5.10.21  5:57 am   opinion on hipsters

5.10.21  3:03 am   bill, I am about to make a lot of content with the intent that thousands might one day see it... I also have just the worst case of anxiety when it comes to how I look, what people think of me, etc. And I wanna go wild and crazy and be goofy and be myself but how can I do this when my self image is literally *pfft*
5.10.21  2:06 am   have you ever wrote a song without the letter "e" in it
5.10.21  12:25 am   why is it so hard to do something productive

5.10.21  12:19 am   What exactly is your connection to Scary Pockets?

     I found two videos where you were playing drums for them.

     Are they your friends?

5.9.21  8:44 pm   do you think the louder you get a mix, the tighter the volume levels have to be for its elements? sometimes i want to just put a "maximizer" on my master and realize as soon as i start pumping everything, the unbalances become more noticeable, the loud start feeling louder in comparison to the mix etc. im not sure if its the maximizer, just the volume perception, or what.
5.9.21  6:56 pm   the citi building now says altice

5.9.21  6:07 pm   there are so many problems going on in the world: the environment, poverty, governmental issues.

     i believe that i would have the ability to dedicate myself to one of these and do my part in some way by studying applied science, economics, or politics, but at this point in my life i find myself much more focused on artistic pursuits in music and mathematics. i know artists are important to society, but i can't help but often think that my work would be better spent trying to solve those more dumpster-fire-like issues i mentioned. i know you are currently and have been for a while very fully focused on your artistic pursuits, and i admire that a lot and would enjoy being in such a position as well. but part of me feels like it's unfair for me to just dance on the sidelines while everyone else is in the middle of all the real problems. has this ever been a concern for you?
5.9.21  5:12 pm   was the "storm" in the video for "here comes the sun" meant to be a coronavirus or was that an accident?

5.9.21  3:02 pm   What is your song writing process/

      how do you try to think of ideas for songs?

      Do all of your songs have some kind of meaning?

      Thanks!
5.9.21  2:53 pm   what is the first letter of the next songs?
5.9.21  2:49 pm   will there be an airhorn in your next song?
5.9.21  2:30 pm   If someone who has never heard one of your songs before asked you personally which one they should listen to, what would you say?
5.9.21  1:53 pm   bill how have you gotten through quarantine?

5.9.21  1:18 pm   i feel like ive broken character so many times that i need to start from scratch to make it all about something else than the broken character. what  is your favorite relaxation technique?
5.9.21  1:14 pm   Do you think people will stop using money someday?
5.9.21  1:08 pm   is there anything you really want to learn how to do that you haven't gotten around to yet?
5.9.21  12:16 pm   what does money mean

5.9.21  10:14 am   I've seen you have one word answers to pretty long questions, but I wonder what's the equivalent from the other side, like have you ever gone ham with your answer on one word questions or so?
5.9.21  8:53 am   Are you often neutral in your emotions

5.9.21  5:35 am   I think people keep asking "when's the album coming" because they expect you to make a fully commercial album, released by big record label, imprinted on cd/vinyl. Maybe that would be a good idea 10-15 years ago, but considering the changing circumstances in the industry, self-publishing becomes more profitable, thus more preferable option. What do you think?
5.9.21  3:58 am   how do you prime factor numbers so well? you're great at doing it
5.9.21  3:11 am   what is meant by seeing the light of day in your song "rabbit snakes"?
5.9.21  1:29 am   Where do you get the context/ideas for your music?
5.9.21  1:18 am   thoughts on the ampersand?
5.8.21  10:02 pm   I notice that some of your Jazz songs are 5+ minutes long, did you just put loops or improvs? Whatever it is, It sounds really cool.

5.8.21  8:45 pm   hey bill! i have this kinda old song that ive been trying to work on, and i cant for the life of me figure out a bridge/new part for it, and i feel it needs something.
its a slow thing kinda r&b-ish, and it chord plays for one bar:
the verses are a Cmaj7 - Am7 - Dm7 - F/G loop, and the chorus is Fm7 - Em7 - Am7 - Dm7 x2 coming right after the Dm7 in the last bar of the verse, and after the chorus theres a transitional F/G to return to the verses.
so far i have a verse/chorus/verse/chorus structure and i want to write a bridge after that 2nd chorus, but then i would like to somehow arrive to a Fm7 to have a 3rd and final chorus/ending kinda thing. any recommendations? ideas?
5.8.21  7:20 pm   what's the story behind the bread at the end of 7.1.14 tuesday video?
